intro: Trichera dipsacifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows from a fibrous root system and has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Trichera dipsacifolia is adapted to drought conditions and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
